Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical vs. Medical Treatment for Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus: Long-term Patient Reported Outcomes

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB), sleeve gastrectomy (SG), or intensive medical therapy (IMT).

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB), sleeve gastrectomy (SG), or intensive medical therapy (IMT).

Objective.evidence: The STAMPEDE trial aimed to investigate the long-term effects of surgical and medical treatments on patient-reported outcomes (PROs) in type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) patients with obesity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: RAND-36, EQ-5D-3L, and a diabetes-specific instrument at baseline and annually for 5 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 104 participants were randomised: 35 to RYGB, 35 to SG, and 34 to IMT.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on all participants using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: RYGB and SG significantly improved physical functioning, general health perception, energy/fatigue, and diabetes-related QoL compared to IMT.

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
